result.execSummary:
The defendant Lance Dion Windom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge, if not already done.
Pay costs, assessments and surcharges.  DOC to collect at rate of 25% of funds.  Balance as condition of Extended  supervison.  Failure to pay by end of sentence is entry of civil judgment and subject to other collection.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to time now being served.

superMiscConds.notes: No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant he cannot possess firerms,  and cannot vote until his civil rigths are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds. Statements by counsel, Lindsey K. and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 4 years - consecutive to time now being served -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 2 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 2 years; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) seek and maintain employment.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge - if not already done
-  DOC to collect monetary amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as amended in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Defendant Lance Dion Windom in court with attorney Christopher S Carson.  Defendant Lance Dion Windom in custody.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

On motion of the State, Court orders the penalty enhancer "Repeater" is DISMISSED.

Attorney Christopher S Carson in court, defendant Lance Dion Windom not in court, in custody.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea date scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lance Dion Windom in court with attorney Christopher S. Carson.  Defendant Lance Dion Windom in custody.  Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Hearing on motion to suppress due to illegal search proceeds.  Sworn-in for the State:  Milwuakee Police Officer Kim Lastrilla.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Sworn-in for the defense:  Lance Windom.  Defense rests.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Arguments by counsel.  Court makes findings of fact.  Court finds the officers testimony is credible; the officer had consent to look for the cell phone and then found the gun from a position where she had consent to be.  Court denies motion to suppress.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State's Response to Motion to Suppress Evidence received and filed./ds
Motion to Suppress Evidence-Vehicle Search received and filed./ds

Attorney Christopher S Carson in court, defendant Lance Dion Windom not in court, in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Mothions to be filed by 3-6-14; response/reply by 3-24-14.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lance Dion Windom in court with attorney Christopher S Carson.  Defendant Lance Dion Windom in custody.  Paul Hauer for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Brian Adkins-MPD Officer.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #09CF4088 that are attached to the complaint.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is reassigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lance Dion Windom in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Lance Dion Windom in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
 DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
